title.narrative: Priorities for Coconut Research and Development

description.narrative: The coconut palm is a major oil seed crop, widely distributed in the moist tropics. It is much utilised in Asia and the Pacific, supplying food, drink and materials for fuel, shelter and stock feed. More than 50 million people are directly involved in coconut production and 96% of production is from holdings of 4 ha or less. Because it is adapted to harsh conditions such as high salinity, high soil pH, soils of low fertility, and drought, the coconut has an important role in fragile ecosystems. In some areas, it is the only suitable commercial crop. This project will identify the priorities for coconut research and development activities in the Pacific region.
